column3: It was nice to have a convention that was so clean and large. The staff was super friendly and the meetings had great support for extra seating , sound etc. I liked having LA Live so close. Felt safe to walk from convention center to hotel and restaurants. Surrounding area not so safe nor would I recommend

NOTE: the office moved in summer, 2018 to the ground floor of Intercontinental Hotel building. Look for it. Staffers Mark and Brittany spent 15 minutes patiently and enthusiastically outlining activities for our day visit. They made calls on our behalf and provided maps and brochures to add value and meaning to our visits. Well worth the stop.

column2: Good, Once You Can Find It ...
column3: Why it's located where it is remains a mystery to me, but it's loaded with great brochures, maps, pamphlets and discount vouchers, plus a very friendly and accommodating staff. Parking is a challenge and you'd do best walking there from other downtown venues. ...
We stopped by the Los Angeles Convention and Visitors Bureau to get information and some discounts for our visit to LA. Staff was very helpful.
It is good but problem to find. It is only this small circle with this title. From street it is real problem,. There are profesional stuff.

column2: Get maps here, and directions from live people.
column3: Lots of brochures. Good maps of downtown, but it lacked maps for DASH buses in the rest of the city. Internet computers were broken the day I was there.
